home.first-text: For three months, the MOVE & ACT consortium will be conducting the Photovoice Contest Platform. This innovative project encourages young people to express their creativity and voice through digital photography. The main purpose of this platform is to empower youth, increase their employability, help them form a European identity, and engage with local, national, and European communities.

works.fourth-header: Voting hasn't started yet. You can view all the contest phases in the "About" section.
works.first-text: There are 25 works from 5 countries: Poland, Greece, Italy, Spain, Lithuania.
works.second-text: You can vote for 5 works, each from a different country.
works.third-text: To choose works from specific select one of the 5 flags. The highlighted flag will indicate the origin of the displayed works.
works.fourth-text: After selecting the flag you will see 5 works from the selected country.
works.fifth-text: To vote for a specific work click "Vote" button.
works.sixth-text: To see more details about the work click the "Details" button.

guidelines.fourth-subheader: Move & Act - Empower Youth through Entrepreneurial and Digital Skills.
guidelines.first-accordion-header: What is the The Move&Act Photo-Voice Contest?
guidelines.first-accordion-third-text: is part of the Erasmus+ project
guidelines.first-accordion-fourth-text: Move & Act- Empower Youth through Entrepreneurial and Digital Skills
guidelines.first-accordion-fifth-text: This initiative aims to develop digital, creative and entrepreneurial skills among young people, especially those who are at risk due to disabilities, migration status or as NEETs (Not in Education, Employment, or Training). The contest provides a
guidelines.first-accordion-sixth-text: platform for participants to express their challenges and experiences through photography
guidelines.first-accordion-seventh-text: , thereby improving their employability, fostering a European identity and
guidelines.first-accordion-nineth-text: with the local, national and European community.
guidelines.second-accordion-first-text: Photo-Voice is a qualitative research method that combines
guidelines.second-accordion-fifth-text: to document and address social issues. This method was developed in the 1990s by Caroline Wang and Mary Ann Burris and enables communities to
guidelines.second-accordion-tenth-text: that reflect their experiences, challenges or perspectives on specific topics such as poverty, unemployment, education, environmental issues and more. These photos will be accompanied by narratives that
guidelines.second-accordion-eleventh-text: contextualise the images and provide deeper insight
guidelines.third-accordion-first-text: Participants must submit photos that fit one of the following themes:
guidelines.third-accordion-nineth-text: Introspective images (e.g. self-portraits, LGBTQ+, mental health)
